opened_prs.title: chore(deps): weekly `cargo update`
opened_prs.body:
Automation to keep dependencies in `Cargo.lock` current.
cargo update log

```log Updating git repository `https://github.com/alloy-rs/evm` Updating git repository `https://github.com/bluealloy/revm` Updating git repository `https://github.com/paradigmxyz/revm-inspectors` Locking 25 packages to latest compatible versions Updating alloy-dyn-abi v0.8.21 -> v0.8.22 Updating alloy-eip7702 v0.5.0 -> v0.5.1 Updating alloy-json-abi v0.8.21 -> v0.8.22 Updating alloy-primitives v0.8.21 -> v0.8.22 Updating alloy-sol-macro v0.8.21 -> v0.8.22 Updating alloy-sol-macro-expander v0.8.21 -> v0.8.22 Updating alloy-sol-macro-input v0.8.21 -> v0.8.22 Updating alloy-sol-type-parser v0.8.21 -> v0.8.22 Updating alloy-sol-types v0.8.21 -> v0.8.22 Updating async-compression v0.4.18 -> v0.4.20 Downgrading base64ct v1.7.0 -> v1.6.0 Unchanged bindgen v0.70.1 (available: v0.71.1) Updating bitflags v2.8.0 -> v2.9.0 Updating blake3 v1.6.0 -> v1.6.1 Unchanged c-kzg v1.0.3 (available: v2.0.0) Updating cc v1.2.15 -> v1.2.16 Updating console v0.15.10 -> v0.15.11 Unchanged convert_case v0.7.1 (available: v0.8.0) Updating crunchy v0.2.2 -> v0.2.3 Unchanged generic-array v0.14.7 (available: v1.2.0) Unchanged hash-db v0.15.2 (available: v0.16.0) Updating litemap v0.7.4 -> v0.7.5 Unchanged rand v0.8.5 (available: v0.9.0) Updating rand_core v0.9.2 -> v0.9.3 Updating syn-solidity v0.8.21 -> v0.8.22 Updating tokio-rustls v0.26.1 -> v0.26.2 Unchanged tower v0.4.13 (available: v0.5.2) Updating uuid v1.15.0 -> v1.15.1 Unchanged vergen v8.3.2 (available: v9.0.4) Updating zerocopy v0.8.20 -> v0.8.21 Updating zerocopy-derive v0.8.20 -> v0.8.21 Updating zerofrom v0.1.5 -> v0.1.6 Updating zerofrom-derive v0.1.5 -> v0.1.6 note: to see how you depend on a package, run `cargo tree --invert --package @` ```

opened_prs.title: refactor(txpool): change blob_tx_priority return type from i64 to u64
opened_prs.body:
This commit implements the TODO in the blob_tx_priority function by changing its return type from i64 to u64.

The function now returns 0 for the best case (when all deltas are positive) and a positive u64 value for worse cases, where higher values represent transactions that need more fee jumps.

The BlobOrd struct and its comparison logic have been updated accordingly, simplifying the ordering logic. A test has been added to verify the new implementation.

opened_prs.title: wip:fest: test runner
opened_prs.body:
some scaffoling.

the idea here is that we create an insance (e.g. a node) and then execute various actions (tests) on it.

this is quite simple, but we need a ton of helper `Actions` that perform various reusable tasks, e.g. replay x blocks, reorg action.
the asserts would then be applied against the outcome of an action for example.

this needs some design validation and more scaffolding

opened_prs.title: Inverted Provider Access in SparseTrie and necessary refactoring/modifications
opened_prs.body:
Potentially fixes #14646

- I am not sure if this was asked to be done or the work required to close this issue. I have inverted the provider access in the `SparseTrie` and the `RevealedSparseTrie` and have made the necessary changes by adding a generic and argument for the provider to the functions `update_leaf` and `remove_leaf`
- I have also updated the tests to take in this additional parameter

There is one issue, in [crates/trie/trie/src/witness.rs](https://github.com/paradigmxyz/reth/blob/main/crates/trie/trie/src/witness.rs#L140)
https://github.com/paradigmxyz/reth/blob/f0c9ca68d761711be498ede87f44f51865d72839/crates/trie/trie/src/witness.rs#L140-L148

I need to add another parameter for the new argument passed in these two functions. What should they be?

opened_prs.title: feat(engine): Implement EIP-7685 requests and EIP-2935 syscall in create_reorg_head
opened_prs.body:
There were some `TODO`s and missing code regarding changes for the Prague upgrade. This PR adds the following:

- Changes the call to `apply_beacon_root_contract_call` to `apply_pre_execution_changes`, so that both the beacon root and the parent hash syscalls are processed
- Processes EIP-7685 requests, as well as upgrades the returned `ExecutionPayloadSidecar`

opened_prs.title: feat: don't include hashes of preimages in execution witness
opened_prs.body:
Switch execution witness to return vectors instead of hashes. There's no reason to include the hash of the preimage in the response, potentially allowing callers to trust the EL client unnecessarily. No other clients implement this RPC and the only usage currently is in optimism and kona. I'll update these usages once this is merged.

Request from geth team here: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/30613#issuecomment-2531732780

Once this is complete, I can start implementing `debug_executePayload` method in geth and execution-apis.

Edit: this is blocked by https://github.com/paradigmxyz/reth/pull/14503

opened_prs.title: perf(root): chunk proof targets in state root task
opened_prs.body:
Towards https://github.com/paradigmxyz/reth/issues/14417

Given proof targets with 100 accounts, it's preferred to spawn 20 multiproofs with 5 accounts each, instead of spawning one multiproof for all 100 accounts at once. The reason for that is that 20 multiproofs can be executed in parallel (even considering that they may do redundant work because of the intersecting trie nodes), while one multiproof will be executed serially for all accounts.

Same idea can be applied to storage slots: proof targets with 1 account and 100 storage slots is better spawned as 5 multiproofs for 20 storage slots each, rather than one multiproof for all 100 storage slots at once.

This PR adds chunking on the `StateRootTask` side, so that every set of proof targets is broken into multiple state updates using `ChunkedProofTargets` iterator, and spawned as a separate multiproof. This is applied to both `on_prefetch_proof` and `on_state_update`

labels.description: A change motivated by improving speed, memory usage or disk footprint

closed_prs.title: Use `AsyncFnOnce` in consensus builder
closed_prs.body:
I got it working @DaniPopes, re: https://github.com/paradigmxyz/reth/pull/14725#issuecomment-2688476235

before adding `#![feature(unboxed_closures)]` I got error
```
error[E0658]: the precise format of `Fn`-family traits' type parameters is subject to change
  --> crates/node/builder/src/components/consensus.rs:29:13
   |
29 |    for <'a> <F as AsyncFnOnce<(&'a BuilderContext<Node>,)>>::CallOnceFuture: Send,
   |             ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ help: use parenthetical notation instead: `AsyncFnOnce(&'a BuilderContext<Node>) -> ()`
   |
   = note: see issue #29625 <https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/29625> for more information
   = help: add `#![feature(unboxed_closures)]` to the crate attributes to enable
   = note: this compiler was built on 2025-02-26; consider upgrading it if it is out of date
```
but then when I changed to the suggested parenthetical syntax I also got an error. but makes sense that the error message isn't correct since this is a feature in development.

closed_prs.title: feat(trie): utility methods for getting difference for `MultiProofTargets`
closed_prs.body:

lighthouse  `v5.1.222-exp-2cd0e60`
Getting an `outOfFunds` error on callTracer 

```
      "calls": [
          {
            "from": "0x12ca55a514345f86fa23e5aea7817a3eb19c3926",
            "gas": "0x8fc",
```

```
curl  -X POST \

}'
```

opened_issues.title: Only invoke invalid_block hook if block isn't already invalid

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: D-good-first-issue
labels.description: Nice and easy! A great choice to get started

opened_issues.body:
### Describe the feature

currently we invoke the 

https://github.com/paradigmxyz/reth/blob/6abe4407fbb06465b693221f01a930a6d604b1e0/crates/engine/tree/src/tree/mod.rs#L2399-L2399

everytime we have an invalid block.

we don't want to process invalid blocks again if we already have them marked as invalid
here:

https://github.com/paradigmxyz/reth/blob/6abe4407fbb06465b693221f01a930a6d604b1e0/crates/engine/tree/src/tree/mod.rs#L480-L480

we should check this before invoking the hook

## TODO

opened_issues.title: Tracking: SDK examples

labels.name: C-tracking-issue
labels.description: An issue that collects information about a broad development initiative

labels.name: A-sdk
labels.description: Related to reth's use as a library

opened_issues.body:
## Feature Description

We want to be able to express EVM chains via the Reth SDK, enabling these chains to leverage our standardized infrastructure rather than maintaining their own forks.

### Problem Statement
There are several teams that fork Reth and find it difficult to maintain the fork. We want these teams to be able to use the Reth SDK for their specific chain requirements.

### In Scope
- Work with World-chain (they already use Reth SDK), incorporate their suggestions & improvements:
- Document the process for other chains to leverage Reth SDK, creating a clear path for adoption

opened_issues.title: Tracking: Custom Nodelauncher

labels.name: C-tracking-issue
labels.description: An issue that collects information about a broad development initiative

labels.name: A-sdk
labels.description: Related to reth's use as a library

opened_issues.body:
## Feature Description

Restructure the Consensus Engine to be flexbile and reusable

### Problem Statement
Not all nodes use the Engine API as the consensus engine; our current tree implementation lacks the flexibility required for reuse across different contexts. 

### Acceptance Criteria
- The Engine module is restructured with clear separation of concerns
- We can successfully implement a custom consensus engine via NodeLauncher
- Existing functionality continues to work without breaking changes
- Documentation and examples are provided for creating custom Engine implementations
- Tests to verify that the restructured components work correctly

opened_issues.title: Tracking: Extracting OP STF (Executor)

labels.name: C-tracking-issue
labels.description: An issue that collects information about a broad development initiative

labels.name: A-sdk
labels.description: Related to reth's use as a library

opened_issues.body:
## Feature Description

This tracking issus involves work on the Reth SDK to improve reusability of the OP block executor.

### Problem Statement

For Kona/Succinct, there's significant code duplication required when trying to re-use the OP block executor leading to maintenance overhead.

### In Scope
- Kona should be able to replace their OP block executor entirely based on alloy-evm
- no-std compatibility
- Create a modular design that allows for easy consumption of the executor
- Provide clear interfaces and documentation for integration

opened_issues.title: Check the payload hash against previously tracked invalid blocks

labels.name: C-bug
labels.description: An unexpected or incorrect behavior

labels.name: A-engine
labels.description: Related to the engine implementation

opened_issues.body:
we currently apply:

https://github.com/paradigmxyz/reth/blob/cf73f6eed609b79ada2b9baf19e117eb1bc45e0b/crates/engine/tree/src/tree/mod.rs#L1895-L1919

when we receive a new payload.

however this function only checks the parent or an ancestor first:

https://github.com/paradigmxyz/reth/blob/cf73f6eed609b79ada2b9baf19e117eb1bc45e0b/crates/engine/tree/src/tree/mod.rs#L906-L915

so if the CL sends us the same (invalid) payload over and over again we don't exit early, because we end up here if the `check` (ancestor) hash is __not__ invalid

https://github.com/paradigmxyz/reth/blob/cf73f6eed609b79ada2b9baf19e117eb1bc45e0b/crates/engine/tree/src/tree/mod.rs#L1905-L1905

hence we proceed to process the same payload over and over again if its parent __is not__ invalid

This should also check that the head block is __not__ invalid

## TODO

* don't return early and check if the head hash is invalid before return None if not invalid

opened_issues.title: Subscribe block logs by websocket

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: S-needs-triage
labels.description: This issue needs to be labelled

opened_issues.body:
### Describe the feature

Hi,

Currently, there is a RPC function subscribe(“logs”), which recieve logs one by one, like this:

```
-> subscribe("logs")
-> evt1 # block N
-> evt2 # block N
-> evt3 # block N
-> ....
-> evt1 # block N+1
-> evt2 # block N+1
-> ....
```

Sometimes, we need subscribe the whole block logs, something like this:

```
-> subscribeBlockLogs()
-> [evt1, evt2, evt3 ....] # block N
-> [evt1, evt2, evt3 ....] # block N+1
-> [evt1, evt2, evt3 ....] # block N+1
```




### Additional context

_No response_

opened_issues.title: Use latest block in DB for fetching reverts in trie input creation

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: New feature or request

labels.name: C-perf
labels.description: A change motivated by improving speed, memory usage or disk footprint

labels.name: A-engine
labels.description: Related to the engine implementation

labels.name: A-trie
labels.description: Related to Merkle Patricia Trie implementation

opened_issues.body:
Right now when creating `TrieInput` for the sparse trie we:
* Check whether we have blocks in-memory for the given parent, giving us an anchor hash and list of in-memory canonical blocks.
* Call `consistent_view.revert_state` using the anchor hash we get (this may be behind the current DB tip!), which creates a DB provider and calls `reverts_to` up to the hash
* Call `trie_input.append(revert_state)`, which constructs prefix sets based on the reverts.

This is sub optimal, if the parent hash we are computing trie input for, is in the DB, or there is a block newer than the anchor hash in the DB already.

In this function:
https://github.com/paradigmxyz/reth/blob/2101ae8918f4efbd1cfccb04f49f91cd990a5371/crates/engine/tree/src/tree/mod.rs#L2666-L2692

We should remove the in-memory blocks that are already on-disk, and use the latest hash on disk if possible when constructing reverts. This way, we can avoid creating reverts that we shouldn't need if we're computing the trie input for a block that extends the DB tip.

and we can remove the option here and treat the _ => as a false

then we can simplify all of this is_some_and calls like:

https://github.com/paradigmxyz/reth/blob/bdb35ae30b6486c5cf8f06ba4aebad248ea8f861/crates/consensus/common/src/calc.rs#L28-L28

closed_issues.title: Cannot sync Sepolia on v1.2.0

labels.name: C-bug
labels.description: An unexpected or incorrect behavior

labels.name: S-needs-triage
labels.description: This issue needs to be labelled

closed_issues.body:
### Describe the bug

I've been syncing Sepolia and it has been taking a week+ (which is kind of odd as my mainnet sync finished). Trying to debug why, here are some logs from it:
```sh
2025-02-25T03:14:19.576569Z  INFO Committed stage progress pipeline_stages=2/12 stage=Bodies checkpoint=7245002 target=7779670 stage_progress=93.12%
2025-02-25T03:14:19.587454Z  INFO Preparing stage pipeline_stages=2/12 stage=Bodies checkpoint=7245002 target=7779670
```
a day later:
```sh
2025-02-25T18:32:33.889035Z  INFO Committed stage progress pipeline_stages=2/12 stage=Bodies checkpoint=4135002 target=7784270 stage_progress=53.11%
2025-02-25T18:32:33.915350Z  INFO Preparing stage pipeline_stages=2/12 stage=Bodies checkpoint=4135002 target=7784270
```

It seems like it failed to progres through pipeline_stage 2 and restarted.

This is on Reth v1.2.0 w/ Lighthouse v6.0.1.

If I search logs for invalid block, I see this:
```sh
d logs eth-docker-execution-1 | grep 'invalid'
2025-02-26T05:09:01.572886Z  WARN Bad block detected in unwind invalid_block=BlockWithParent { parent: 0xee25b2818a55650e5e72ea1a5720443025287974e24c3ba990dc685ccb430f0b, block: NumHash { number: 1464868, hash: 0x5823c40f00dd4e213b0a8cdbead2aea3b88d5e50da29dc3847e1dddb3ee4e906 } }
2025-02-26T06:29:47.150059Z  WARN Bad block detected in unwind invalid_block=BlockWithParent { parent: 0xee25b2818a55650e5e72ea1a5720443025287974e24c3ba990dc685ccb430f0b, block: NumHash { number: ...
```

More context around that error:

closed_issues.title: Make `ValidationApi` generic over `PayloadValidator` type

labels.name: S-needs-design
labels.description: This issue requires design work to think about how it would best be accomplished

labels.name: A-rpc
labels.description: Related to the RPC implementation

labels.name: A-op-reth
labels.description: Related to Optimism and op-reth

closed_issues.body:
### Describe the feature

Make `ValidationApi` generic over `PayloadValidator` type. The main thing that's needs to be designed here is how to construct the generic `ExecutionPayload` type. Reth has a tendency to prefer using the `ExecutionPayloadProvider` pattern as opposed to adding constructor trait methods to `ExecutionPayload`.

For example this method is effected
https://github.com/paradigmxyz/reth/blob/4565cda599461146d54431a3389e07350017d9e5/crates/rpc/rpc/src/validation.rs#L355-L374

### Additional context

_No response_

wartime_milady_ceo_summary: - **Summary of the Week's PRs and Issues**: This week's activity in the repository focused heavily on maintenance and refactoring, with several PRs aimed at cleaning up code, removing redundancies, and fixing bugs. There was a notable emphasis on improving the codebase's organization and addressing technical debt, which is crucial for long-term project sustainability.

- **PR #14775: Chore(sdk): Clean up op engine caps** - This PR focused on cleaning up the SDK by removing redundant functions and fields related to engine capabilities. It streamlined the instantiation of `EngineCapabilities` with OP capabilities, reflecting a continuous effort to simplify and optimize the codebase.
